metasploit: Metasploit was originally created by HD Moore in 2003.
It contains over 1500 exploits for various systems.
Metasploit is written in Ruby programming language.
It's now owned and maintained by Rapid7.
wireshark: It can capture and analyze packets in real-time.
It's the world's most widely-used network protocol analyzer.
nmap: Nmap was created by Gordon Lyon (Fyodor) in 1997.
It can scan thousands of ports in seconds.
Nmap was featured in The Matrix Reloaded movie.
It's written in C, C++, Python, and Lua.
burpsuite: Burp Suite was created by PortSwigger.
It's primarily used for web application security testing.
It can intercept and modify web requests in real-time.
johntheripper: John the Ripper was created by Alexander Peslyak.
It can crack multiple password formats.
The free version supports over 400 hash types.
It's named after the infamous serial killer Jack the Ripper.
aircrack: Aircrack-ng is a complete suite of tools for WiFi security.
It can crack WEP and WPA-PSK keys.
It works on multiple operating systems.
owaspzap: OWASP ZAP is completely free and open source.
It's maintained by a dedicated international team of volunteers.
ZAP can automatically find security vulnerabilities in web applications.
hydra: Hydra can perform rapid dictionary attacks against more than 50 protocols.
It was developed by van Hauser of THC.
Hydra supports parallel testing of multiple targets.
It's named after the nine-headed serpent in Greek mythology.
nikto: Nikto was created by Chris Sullo.
It can perform comprehensive tests against web servers.
The tool can identify over 6700 potentially dangerous files/programs.
It can scan multiple ports on a server simultaneously.
beef: BeEF stands for Browser Exploitation Framework.
It's written primarily in Ruby and JavaScript.
BeEF focuses on leveraging browser vulnerabilities.
gobuster: Gobuster is written in Go programming language.
It's used for directory and DNS enumeration.
It can perform DNS subdomain brute forcing.
It's known for its high-performance concurrent scanning.
searchsploit: SearchSploit is the offline version of Exploit-DB.
It contains over 40,000 exploits and proof-of-concept code.
Updates can be downloaded daily to stay current.
hashcat: Hashcat is the world's fastest password cracker.
It supports over 300 different hash types.
It can utilize GPU acceleration for faster cracking.
sqlmap: SQLMap can automatically detect and exploit SQL injection flaws.
It supports over 70 different parameters to tweak its testing.
It can identify and exploit all major database systems.
It's written in Python and is open source.
exploitdb: It contains over 40,000 exploits and vulnerabilities.
All submissions are manually verified by security professionals.
maltego: Maltego is used for open-source intelligence and forensics.
It can visualize complex relationships between information.
It can integrate with over 100 different data sources.
netcat: Netcat is often called the 'Swiss Army knife' of networking tools.
It was originally written by Hobbit in 1995.
It can act as both a client and a server.
It's commonly used for port scanning and file transfers.
